body:
C++ CompletionQueue is for grpc events only and you cannot put a custom callback to it.

What you may want to do is to have one or more dedicated thread to call cq_.Next and once you get a callback, dispatch it to a separated thread pool to run instead of running callback() in place. Then for your custom stuff, you can just say thread_pool_->Add(custom_callback).

I'm somewhat open to adding an API for this however. We'd need to plumb it
through the C stack, but I can certainly see the usefulness.

void grpc_completion_queue_push_tag(grpc_completion_queue *cq, void *tag);

On Tue, Jul 19, 2016 at 10:39 AM Yang Gao notifications@github.com wrote:

> C++ CompletionQueue is for grpc events only and you cannot put a custom
> callback to it.
> 
> What you may want to do is to have one or more dedicated thread to call
> cq_.Next and once you get a callback, dispatch it to a separated thread
> pool to run instead of running callback() in place. Then for your custom
> stuff, you can just say thread_pool_->Add(custom_callback).
